string.value: Error while generating the video, please check your output_log.txt file.
The folder where videos are stored
The folder where frames are stored
The current video format does not support this bit depth.
Gifski tool is only compatible with PNG images.
The frame rate at which the game is captured.
The frame rate of the exported video.
The rate at which DynamicBone physics update. Default is 60/s.

The tool used to take screenshots:
[Screenshot Manager] the Screencap plugin (uses its settings)
[Builtin] VideoExport's internal screenshot implementation
[Reshade] uses KKReshade addon to capture Reshade effects

Limit recording by:
[Frames] record for a number of frames
[Seconds] record for a number of seconds
[Animation] record for the length of a builtin animation (selected character)
[Timeline] record for the length of the timeline
Runs warm-up loops before starting the capture.\nCan be used to align physics and record a loop animation.
Reconds a number of loops of timeline / animation.
Records for a number of selected frames / seconds.
Set timeline to 00:00 and wait for physics before recording.
Performance setting. Disable this if recording fails.
[Normal] Recommended. Renders the camera to guarantee up-to-date frame. \n[Immediate] Faster, assumes the camera is already rendered.

[BMP] Lossless, very fast encoding, large space requirement
[PNG] Lossless, slow encoding, medium space requirement
[JPG] Lossy, fast encoding, low space requirement
[EXR] Lossless, very slow encoding, large space requirement, HDR

[MP4] General purpose widely supported video format
[WEBM] Video format optimized for web
[GIF] Old image format for short clips and loops
[MOV] Video format used in professional editing (high space requirement)
[WEBP] Image format optimized for web (supports animation)
[AVIF] Modern image format based on the AV1 codec (supports animation)
Some Reshade effects do not play well with the alpha channel.\nEnable this if the PNG screenshots are fully transparent.\nAlso makes the PNGs smaller.
[H.264] Widely used and supported. Recommended.\n[H.265] More efficient, but may not be fully supported everywhere.
[VP8] Widely used and supported. Recommended.\n[VP9] More efficient, but many not be fully supported everywhere.
[ProRes] Produces very large files meant for professional video editing.
[Libaom-av1] Widely supported, lossless quality, slow encoding.\n[Libsvt-av1] Good quality, fast encoding.
Fast encoding using GPU accelerated codecs.\nLess efficient, produces larger files for the same quality.

[FFmpeg] Good quality, widely supported. Slightly larger.
 Global palette, 256 colors total. Dithering optional.
[Gifsky] Highest quality, smoother, but may cause flickering.
 Local palette, 256 colors per frame. Dithering mandatory.

Fakes colors outside of the limited palette:
[none] No dithering. Recommended until visually necessary.
[bayer] Creates visible dither patterns/aesthetic.
[floyd_steinberg] Creates smooth gradients and relatively low noise.

[ProRes422Proxy] Lowest.
[ProRes422LT] Low.
[ProRes422] Moderate.
[ProRes422HQ] Standard.
[ProRes4444] High.
[ProRes4444XQ] Highest
Lower quality may give smaller file [default: 90]
Lower values introduce noise and streaks
